verses.verse: Blessed <WH1288> be the Lord <WH3068> my strength <WH6697>, which teaches <WH3925> my hands <WH3027> to war <WH7128>, and my fingers <WH676> to fight <WH4421>:

My goodness <WH2617>, and my fortress <WH4686>; my high tower <WH4869>, and my deliverer <WH6403>; my shield <WH4043>, and he in whom I trust <WH2620>; who subdues <WH7286> my people under me <WH5971>.
Lord <WH3068>, what is man <WH120>, that you take knowledge <WH3045> of him <WH1121>! or the son of man <WH582>, that you make account of him <WH2803>!
Man <WH120> is like <WH1819> to vanity <WH1892>: his days <WH3117> are as a shadow <WH6738> that passes away <WH5674>.
Bow <WH5186> your heavens <WH8064>, O Lord <WH3068>, and come down <WH3381>: touch <WH5060> the mountains <WH2022>, and they shall smoke <WH6225>.
Cast forth <WH1299> lightning <WH1300>, and scatter <WH6327> them <WH7971>: shoot out your arrows <WH2671>, and destroy them <WH2000>.
Send <WH7971> your hand <WH3027> from above <WH4791>; deliver <WH6475> me <WH5337>, and snatch me out of great <WH7227> waters <WH4325>, from the hand <WH3027> of strange <WH5236> sons <WH1121>;
Whose mouth <WH6310> speaks <WH1696> vanity <WH7723>, and their right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood <WH8267>.
I will sing <WH7891> a new <WH2319> song <WH7892> unto you <WH430>, O God: upon a psaltery <WH5035> and a instrument of ten strings <WH6218> will I sing praises unto you <WH2167>.
It is he that gives <WH5414> salvation <WH8668> unto kings <WH4428>: who delivers <WH6475> David <WH1732> his servant <WH5650> from the hurtful <WH7451> sword <WH2719>.

Deliver <WH6475> me <WH5337>, and snatch me from the hand <WH3027> of strange <WH5236> sons <WH1121>, whose mouth <WH6310> speaks <WH1696> vanity <WH7723>, and their right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood <WH8267>:

That our sons <WH1121> may be as plants <WH5195> grown up <WH1431> in their youth <WH5271>; that our daughters <WH1323> may be as corner stones <WH2106>, polished <WH2404> after the likeness <WH8403> of a palace <WH1964>:

That our barns <WH4200> may be full <WH4392>, affording <WH6329> all manner of store <WH2177>: that our sheep <WH6629> may bring forth thousands <WH503> and ten thousands <WH7231> in our streets <WH2351>:
That our oxen <WH441> may be strong to labor <WH5445>; that there be no breaking in <WH6556>, nor going out <WH3318>; that there be no complaining <WH6682> in our streets <WH7339>.
Happy <WH835> is that people <WH5971>, that is in such a case <WH3602>: Yes <WH835>, happy is that people <WH5971>, whose God <WH430> is the Lord <WH3068>.
